text: Industrial companies

continuously look for ways
to grow revenue and reduce cost.

When you apply machine
learning to the vast amounts

of industrial data
created by your systems, sensors
and assets,
you can gain critical insights

into your business
to run it more efficiently.

Machine learning can enable
predictive maintenance
by proactively

monitoring the condition
of your industrial equipment

and alerting you to
any anomalies, helping prevent

machinery failures
and expensive downtime.

Computer vision,
powered by machine learning,

can automate visual quality
inspection to identify defects
quickly and accurately —

even at the edge
with limited bandwidth.

It can also improve visibility
of supply chain processes and

assets by recognizing objects
such as parts or products

to automatically track
throughput, or by reading

container labels
to optimize freight operations.

Safety and noncompliance issues
can be caught faster
by automatically identifying

potential problems
— such as when forklifts

stray into dangerous, off
limit zones — and enabling you

to send alerts to individuals
for immediate action.

Machine learning-powered
forecasting combines time series

data with additional variables
to automatically examine complex

relationships and build models
that are up to 50% more accurate

than simply looking at time
series data alone.

Harness your industrial data
and optimize your business

by using machine
learning services from AWS.
